input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: Orange Schools Campus closed through the end of the school year

span.div: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Orange Schools campus will be closed from through the end of the school year. All activities, events, athletics, clubs, and field trips are cancelled and all facilities are closed during that time and until further notice.

a.span: Remote Learning Plans for Each School

div.span: The Orange Schools Campus will be closed through the end of the school year

The Orange Schools campus will be closed from March 16 through the end of the school year. All activities, events, athletics, clubs, and field trips are cancelled and all facilities are closed during that time and until further notice.

img.alt: To Learn. To Lead. To Make a Difference.

span.div: The decision to close school facilities statewide creates many questions for students and parents alike. We will continue to address your questions and concerns through our various communication methods including in this end-of-school-year Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document.

div.br: Each school principal has been working with central office administrators and teacher leaders to develop plans to operationalize the district’s approach to remote learning. These plans are included in each school’s update here: Remote Learning Plan

span.div: Please review our Remote Learning Guide, which provides an overview for our families. Also, review our Guidelines for Online Lesson Etiquette with your child.

div.div: ADMINISTRATION TEAM PLANNING. District and building administrators are working collaboratively through online video conferencing, shared documents and telephone communications. Their focus is on both the current campus closure as well as planning and learning expectations should the closure be extended. The administrative team is working closely with our teachers and staff to continue to provide remote learning experiences for Orange Schools students.

Have a great photo of those virtual learning experiences? Send them to us! We would love to see #TeamOrange in action. Grab a photo of your student(s) in their favorite Orange spirit wear showing "virtual learning" in action. Please E-MAIL your photo to: [email protected]
***Be SURE to include your name, your student(s)' name(s) and grade, and, where appropriate, what they are working on. These photos will be compiled and may be posted throughout the quarter on social media and/or in our publications. Keep an eye out for your own slice of Orange.

span.div: LUNCH FOR STUDENTS IN NEED. On weekdays (M-F) a school bus will be used to transport food to key drop-off locations each day (see flyer). Our food service, transportation staff, and social workers are working together to make this happen. #TeamOrange

div.br:
For those wishing to make a monetary contribution to assist our families in need, please visit our Orange Area Service Committee website here.
If you wish to donate canned goods, pasta, and/or toilet paper, please consider dropping it off at the Garfield Food Pantry located at 3650 Lander Road in Pepper Pike between the hours of 9a-5p.
* * * * *
We will continue to update you as new information arises in what continues to be an ever-changing situation. Thank you for your patience and flexibility as we traverse this uncharted territory. As Governor DeWine noted, “We are all in this together. It is incumbent on all of us to protect all of us.” Thank you, #TeamOrange, for your continued cooperation, patience, and understanding.
